externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's China CDN Manager API

get.description: Returns a list of current provision states for all property hostnames under your account.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's China CDN Manager API

200.description: Provides information for the current provision states of all property hostnames under your account.

provisionStates.description: The provision states for all property hostnames under your account.

items.description: Information about the current change made to the property hostname's deployment in China.

hostname.description: The property hostname the provision state reflects.

partnerStates.description: Specifies the current provision state for each partner based on the provision state change.

pendingChanges.description: Indicates if there are any pending changes in progress for the property hostname.

provisionState.description: The property hostname's current provision state, either `WHITELISTED` indicating you're waiting for approval from the China partner to enable your property `hostname` in China, `PROVISIONED` indicating your property `hostname` is whitelisted and mapped to the provided edge hostname on China CDN, or `DEPROVISIONED` indicating your property `hostname` was removed from the whitelist and unmapped from the edge hostname.

parameters.description: Filter results by the given provision state.
parameters.name: provisionState

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

get.description: Returns a filtered list of provided edge hostnames available for use on a China CDN enabled contract.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's China CDN Manager API

schema.description: Information about the edge hostnames under your account that are available for use on China CDN.

edgeHostnames.description: Information about the edge hostnames provided for use on the China CDN.

items.description: Provides information about the edge hostnames provided to use on China CDN.

edgeHostname.description: This hostname is usually your original origin hostname, suffixed with `.edgesuite.net` or `.edgekey.net`.

status.description: Indicates the status of the edge hostname. `READY` means that you can use the edge hostname to deploy a property hostname in China. `NOT_READY` means the edge hostname isn't configured properly. For example, the edge hostname doesn't have a product ID specified. In this case, the API can't use the edge hostname until you resolve the issue. [Learn more](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-hostnames/reference/get-edgehostnameid). `NOT_SUPPORTED` means the API doesn't automatically manage mapping or unmapping for the DNS zone of the edge hostname. A `null` value means the edge hostname isn't needed for the provision state change. For example, if you're only whitelisting your property hostname.

schema.description: Information about the edge hostnames under your account that are available for use on the China CDN.

edgeHostnames.description: Information about the edge hostnames provided for use on the China CDN.

items.description: Provides information about the edge hostnames provided for use on the China CDN.

edgeHostname.description: This hostname is typically your original origin hostname, suffixed with a DNS zone such as `.edgesuite.net` or `.edgekey.net`.

propertyHostnames.description: The number of property hostnames which use this edge hostname.

status.description: Indicates the status of the edge hostname. `READY` means that you can use the edge hostname to deploy a property hostname in China. `NOT_READY` means the edge hostname isn't configured properly. For example, if the edge hostname doesn't have a product ID specified, the API can't use the edge hostname until you resolve the issue. [Learn more](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-hostnames/reference/get-edgehostnameid). `NOT_SUPPORTED` means the API doesn't automatically manage mapping or unmapping for the DNS zone of the edge hostname. `null` means the edge hostname isn't needed for the provision state change. For example, if you're only whitelisting your property hostname.

unmapSharedEdgeHostname.description: Whether the deprovision policy unmaps the shared edge hostname during the deprovision process.

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's China CDN Manager API

200.description: Provides information about the ICP holding entities.

icpHoldingEntities.description: Information about the ICP holding entity under your account. This information needs to match the information provided when applying for a license to operate in China. Any mismatch can result in Akamai's China partner rejecting your request to whitelist a property `hostname`.

items.description: Provides information about the ICP holding entity under your account. This information needs to match the information provided when applying for a license to operate in China. Any mismatch can result in Akamai's China partner rejecting your request to whitelist a property `hostname`.

businessClassification.description: Identifies the principle function of the ICP holding entity responsible for deploying your web content in China. For available codes, see [Business classification types](https://techdocs.akamai.com/chinacdn/reference/business-classification-types).

comments.description: A descriptive comment about the ICP holding entity.

createdBy.description: The Akamai username who created the ICP holding entity.

createdDate.description: The time the ICP holding entity was created, in ISO 8601 format.

id.description: A unique identifier for the ICP holding entity.

legalEntity.description: The Chinese name of the ICP holding entity printed in the business registration certificate or representative office certificate issued by the Chinese government.

type.description: The legal entity type value. For available codes, see [Legal ID types](https://techdocs.akamai.com/chinacdn/reference/legal-id-types).

name.description: The name of the ICP holding entity.

technicalContact.description: Your technical contact who resides in China.

email.description: The email address of your technical contact in China.

id.description: The ID value of your technical contact in China.

name.description: The name of your technical contact in China.

phone.description: The phone number of your technical contact in China, either cell or landline.

updatedBy.description: The Akamai username who last updated the ICP holding entity.

updatedDate.description: The time the ICP holding entity was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's China CDN Manager API

200.description: Provides information about the ICP numbers issued by the Chinese government under your account.

icpNumbers.description: Information about the ICP number used to identify the ICP license issued to the ICP holding entity by the Chinese government. Your property `hostname` needs to reference the ICP number to deploy it in China. [List ICP numbers](https://techdocs.akamai.com/chinacdn/reference/get-icp-numbers) for the ICP numbers available under your account in China.

items.description: Information about the ICP number used to identify the ICP license issued to the ICP holding entity by the Chinese government. Your property `hostname` needs to reference the ICP number to deploy it in China. [List ICP numbers](https://techdocs.akamai.com/chinacdn/reference/get-icp-numbers) for the ICP numbers available under your account in China.

comments.description: A descriptive comment about the ICP number.

createdBy.description: The Akamai username who created the ICP number.

createdDate.description: The time the ICP number was created, in ISO 8601 format.

icpHoldingEntityId.description: A unique identifier for the ICP holding entity that owns the ICP number.

icpNumber.description: The ICP number that appears in the Chinese government-issued license.

id.description: A unique identifier for the ICP number. On PUT, sets the `icpNumberId` for the property hostname.

updatedBy.description: The Akamai username who last updated the ICP number.

updatedDate.description: The time the ICP number was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

put.description: This operation lets you create or update a property `hostname` based on the group for your current account and contract type. The API responds with a 201 code when you create a new property hostname, and a 200 code thereafter when updating it. If the property `hostname` has a provision status of `WHITELISTED` or `PROVISIONED` and you change the `icpNumberId`, the API creates a China partner re-approval request. If the partner denies the request for any reason, the property hostname's `provisionState` changes to `DEPROVISIONED`.
put.summary: Create or update a property hostname

post.description: Run this operation to change your property hostname's current deployment state. For more information, see the [Provision state change workflow](https://techdocs.akamai.com/chinacdn/reference/provision-state-change-workflow), [Deployment states](https://techdocs.akamai.com/chinacdn/reference/deployment-states), and [Manage property hostnames](https://techdocs.akamai.com/chinacdn/reference/manage-property-hostnames) sections. For delivery in China, Akamai recommends you map the CNAME of your property hostname to the new `*88.net` Chinese operational domain that corresponds to your original edge hostname selection. For example, with an `example.com.edgesuite.net` edge hostname, change the CNAME to `example.com.edgesuite88.net`. For more information, see: [New Chinese operational domains](https://techdocs.akamai.com/chinacdn/docs/add-edit-prop-hn#new-chinese-operational-domains).
post.summary: Create a new provision state change

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's China CDN Manager API

completedDate.description: The date when the provision state change completed, in ISO 8601 format.

createdDate.description: The date when the provision state change was created, in ISO 8601 format.

currentStatus.description: The current status of the provision state change, either `COMPLETED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was successful, `PENDING` indicating your property hostname is awaiting deployment, `CANCELED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was terminated by the China partner, `REJECTED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was denied by the China partner, or `FAILED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was unsuccessful. This typically occurs if you [create a new provision state change](https://techdocs.akamai.com/chinacdn/reference/post-property-hostname-provision-state-change) for a property `hostname` that has a `targetState` change in progress.

edgeHostname.description: The provided edge hostname used to map to your property `hostname` for deployment in China. Use this value only when the `targetState` is `PROVISIONED`. A `null` value means the edge hostname isn't needed for the provision state change. For example, if you're only whitelisting your property hostname.

hostname.description: The hostname that this provision state change affects.

id.description: A unique identifier for the provision state change.

partnerStatuses.description: Specifies the provision statuses for each partner based on the provision state change.

previousState.description: The state of the property `hostname` before this change, either `WHITELISTED` indicating you're waiting for approval from the China partner to enable your property `hostname` in China, `PROVISIONED` indicating your property `hostname` is whitelisted and mapped to the provided edge hostname on China CDN, or `DEPROVISIONED` indicating your property `hostname` was removed from the whitelist and unmapped from the edge hostname.

sendEmail.description: Specifies whether email updates are sent for status changes on this provision state change.

targetState.description: Specifies how you want your property `hostname` deployed in China. Specify `WHITELISTED` to enabled your traffic in China and get approval from the China partner. Specify `PROVISIONED` to whitelist and map your property `hostname` to the provided edge hostname on China CDN. This optimizes your website or application's performance in China. Specify `DEPROVISIONED` to unmap and remove your property `hostname` from the whitelist. If you mapped a property `hostname` to a shared edge hostname, deprovisioning it doesn't unmap the edge hostname from it. It only removes the property `hostname` from the whitelist. This might result in denial of service if your DNS configuration still assigns the property `hostname` to the shared edge hostname.

202.description: Provides information about the change made to the property hostname's deployment in China.

completedDate.description: The date when the provision state change completed, in ISO 8601 format.

createdDate.description: The date when the provision state change was created, in ISO 8601 format.

currentStatus.description: The current status of the provision state change, either `COMPLETED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was successful, `PENDING` indicating your property hostname is awaiting deployment, `CANCELED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was terminated by the China partner, `REJECTED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was denied by the China partner, or `FAILED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was unsuccessful. This typically occurs if you [create a new provision state change](https://techdocs.akamai.com/chinacdn/reference/post-property-hostname-provision-state-change) for a property `hostname` that has a `targetState` change in progress.

edgeHostname.description: The provided edge hostname used to map to your property `hostname` for deployment in China. Use this value only when the `targetState` is `PROVISIONED`. A `null` value means the edge hostname isn't needed for the provision state change. For example, if you're only whitelisting your property hostname.

hostname.description: The hostname that this provision state change affects.

id.description: A unique identifier for the provision state change.

partnerStatuses.description: Specifies the provision statuses for each partner based on the provision state change.

previousState.description: The state of the property `hostname` before this change, either `WHITELISTED` indicating you're waiting for approval from the China partner to enable your property `hostname` in China, `PROVISIONED` indicating your property `hostname` is whitelisted and mapped to the provided edge hostname on China CDN, or `DEPROVISIONED` indicating your property `hostname` was removed from the whitelist and unmapped from the edge hostname.

sendEmail.description: Specifies whether email updates are sent for status changes on this provision state change.

targetState.description: Specifies how you want your property `hostname` deployed in China. Specify `WHITELISTED` to enabled your traffic in China and get approval from the China partner. Specify `PROVISIONED` to whitelist and map your property `hostname` to the provided edge hostname on China CDN. This optimizes your website or application's performance in China. Specify `DEPROVISIONED` to unmap and remove your property `hostname` from the whitelist. If you mapped a property `hostname` to a shared edge hostname, deprovisioning it doesn't unmap the edge hostname from it. It only removes the property `hostname` from the whitelist. This might result in denial of service if your DNS configuration still assigns the property `hostname` to the shared edge hostname.

parameters.description: When deprovisioning a property `hostname` that's mapped to a shared edge hostname, the API responds with an `edgehostname-shared` error. To override the error, set the `forceDeprovision` value to `true`.  This removes the property `hostname` from the whitelist without unmapping the edge hostname from it. To avoid a denial in service once the deprovision is complete, change  the current CNAME from the property `hostname` to the shared edge hostname.
parameters.name: forceDeprovision

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

parameters.description: The fully qualified domain name of the property hostname.
parameters.name: hostname

get.description: Returns details about current deployment changes for the specified property `hostname` under your account.
get.summary: Get the current provision state changes

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's China CDN Manager API

200.description: Contains a list of provisions state changes.

provisionStateChanges.description: Information about the change made to the property hostname's deployment in China.

items.description: Information about the change made to the property hostname's deployment in China.

completedDate.description: The date when the provision state change completed, in ISO 8601 format.

createdDate.description: The date when the provision state change was created, in ISO 8601 format.

currentStatus.description: The current status of the provision state change, either `COMPLETED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was successful, `PENDING` indicating your property hostname is awaiting deployment, `CANCELED` indicating your property  hostname's deployment was terminated by the China partner, `REJECTED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was denied by the China partner, or `FAILED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was unsuccessful. This typically occurs if you [create a new provision state change](https://techdocs.akamai.com/chinacdn/reference/post-property-hostname-provision-state-change) for a property `hostname` that has a `targetState` change in progress.

edgeHostname.description: The provided edge hostname used to map to your property `hostname` for deployment in China. Use this value only when the `targetState` is `PROVISIONED`. A `null` value means the edge hostname isn't needed for the provision state change. For example, if you're only whitelisting your property hostname.

hostname.description: The hostname that this provision state change affects.

id.description: A unique identifier for the provision state change.

partnerStatuses.description: Specifies the provision statuses for each partner based on the provision state change.

partnerStatus.description: Information about each partner's provision state change.

completedDate.description: The time the provision state change for this partner completed, in ISO 8601 format.

currentStatus.description: The China partner's current status, either `COMPLETED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was successful, `PENDING` indicating your property `hostname` is awaiting deployment, `CANCELED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was terminated by the China partner, `REJECTED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was denied by the China partner, or `FAILED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was unsuccessful. This typically occurs if you [create a new provision state change](https://techdocs.akamai.com/chinacdn/reference/post-property-hostname-provision-state-change) for a property `hostname` that has a `targetState` change in progress.

partner.description: Identifies the partner allowed to deploy the property hostname in China.

previousState.description: The China partner's previous provision state change, either `WHITELISTED` indicating you're waiting for approval from the China partner to enable your property `hostname` in China, `PROVISIONED` indicating your property `hostname` is whitelisted and mapped to the provided edge hostname on China CDN, or `DEPROVISIONED` indicating your property `hostname` was removed from the whitelist and unmapped from the edge hostname.

rejection.description: Information on why the partner's provision change failed.

explanation.description: Describes why the requested change was rejected.

reason.description: Indicates why the requested change was rejected. `INVALID_ICP_LICENSE` means the ICP license to provision the property hostname isn't valid.

targetState.description: Specifies how you want your property `hostname` deployed in China. Specify `WHITELISTED` to enabled your traffic in China and get approval from the China partner. Specify `PROVISIONED` to whitelist and map your property `hostname` to the edge hostname. This optimizes your website or application's performance in China. Specify `DEPROVISIONED` to unmap and remove your property `hostname` from the whitelist. If you mapped a property `hostname` to a shared edge hostname, deprovisioning it doesn't unmap the edge hostname from it. It only removes the property `hostname` from the whitelist. This might result in denial of service if your DNS configuration still assigns the property `hostname` to the shared edge hostname.

previousState.description: The state of the property `hostname` before this change, either `WHITELISTED` indicating you're waiting for approval from the China partner to enable your property `hostname` in China, `PROVISIONED` indicating your property `hostname` is whitelisted and mapped to the provided edge hostname on China CDN, or `DEPROVISIONED` indicating your property `hostname` was removed from the whitelist and unmapped from the edge hostname.

sendEmail.description: Specifies whether email updates are sent for status changes on this provision state change.

targetState.description: Specifies how you want your property `hostname` deployed in China. Specify `WHITELISTED` to enabled your traffic in China and get approval from the China partner. Specify `PROVISIONED` to whitelist and map your property `hostname` to the provided edge hostname on China CDN. This optimizes your website or application's performance in China. Specify `DEPROVISIONED` to unmap and remove your property `hostname` from the whitelist. If you mapped a property `hostname` to a shared edge hostname, deprovisioning it doesn't unmap the edge hostname from it. It only removes the property `hostname` from the whitelist. This might result in denial of service if your DNS configuration still assigns the property `hostname` to the shared edge hostname.

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

parameters.description: The fully qualified domain name of the property hostname.
parameters.name: hostname

get.description: Returns details about a specific deployment change for the specified property `hostname`.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's China CDN Manager API

200.description: Provides information about the change made to the property hostname's deployment in China.

completedDate.description: The date when the provision state change completed, in ISO 8601 format.

createdDate.description: The date when the provision state change was created, in ISO 8601 format.

currentStatus.description: The current status of the provision state change, either `COMPLETED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was successful, `PENDING` indicating your property hostname is awaiting deployment, `CANCELED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was terminated by the China partner, `REJECTED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was denied by the China partner, or `FAILED` indicating your property hostname's deployment was unsuccessful. This typically occurs if you [create a new provision state change](https://techdocs.akamai.com/chinacdn/reference/post-property-hostname-provision-state-change) for a property `hostname` that has a `targetState` change in progress.

edgeHostname.description: The provided edge hostname used to map to your property `hostname` for deployment in China. Use this value only when the `targetState` is `PROVISIONED`. A `null` value means the edge hostname isn't needed for the provision state change. For example, if you're only whitelisting your property hostname.

hostname.description: The hostname that this provision state change affects.

id.description: A unique identifier for the provision state change.

partnerStatuses.description: Specifies the provision statuses for each partner based on the provision state change.

previousState.description: The state of the property `hostname` before this change, either `WHITELISTED` indicating you're waiting for approval from the China partner to enable your  property `hostname` in China, `PROVISIONED` indicating your property `hostname` is whitelisted and mapped to the provided edge hostname on China CDN, or `DEPROVISIONED` indicating your property `hostname` was removed from the whitelist and unmapped from the edge hostname.

sendEmail.description: Specifies whether email updates are sent for status changes on this provision state change.

targetState.description: Specifies how you want your property `hostname` deployed in China. Specify `WHITELISTED` to enabled your traffic in China and get approval from the China partner. Specify `PROVISIONED` to whitelist and map your property `hostname` to the provided edge hostname on China CDN. This optimizes your website or application's performance in China. Specify `DEPROVISIONED` to unmap and remove your property `hostname` from the whitelist. If you mapped a property  `hostname` to a shared edge hostname, deprovisioning it doesn't unmap the edge hostname from it. It only removes the property `hostname` from the whitelist. This might result in denial of service if your DNS configuration still assigns  the property `hostname` to the shared edge hostname.

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

parameters.description: A unique identifier for the property hostname's current provision state change.
parameters.name: changeId

parameters.description: The fully qualified domain name of the property hostname.
parameters.name: hostname
